history.content: I had done this myself, and while yes, the workload is manageable (and not as bad as it may seem), I would not recommend it since I always felt like the projects and class were getting in the way of doing the research I wanted.  So in my opinion, put off 61c, and focus on the research- it will be far more rewarding from both a personal and resume-building point of view.  You can always take 61c later.

Hi, so for the summer offering for cs61c, I've heard that the workload is insane, but would I be able to balance this with around a 20 - 30 hour research commitment? I know this isn't the most sane choice but I want to get 61c out of the way so I can focus on my EE classes in the coming fall. Would the workload be comparable to Hillfinger's 61B projects combined with harder midterms?
history.subject: CS61C over the summer with research
